meta.description: The annual survey about the current State of JavaScript

welcome_screens.title:
Thanks for taking this survey! Together, maybe we'll be able to figure out this JavaScript thing once and for all!

Also, we know this survey seems long, but it's mostly the same questions repeated for different frameworks and libraries. Most people only take around *15 minutes* to fill it in.

thankyou_screens.title:
Thanks for completing this typeform
Now *create your own* ‚Äî it's free, easy, & beautiful

fields.title:
Table Of Contents

1. Features ‚Äì Language, syntax‚Ä¶
2. Tools ‚Äì libraries, frameworks‚Ä¶
4. Resources ‚Äì Blogs, podcasts‚Ä¶
5. Opinions ‚Äì How you feel about JavaScript.
6. About You ‚Äì Experience, salary‚Ä¶

- ‚úÖ You've heard about it but *haven't* used it

fields.title:
For each of the following technology, framework, or library mentioned, please pick one of the following options:

- ü§∑ You've never heard about it, or are not sure what it is 
- ‚úÖ You've heard about it and you *want* to learn it 
- üö´ You've heard about it, but *don't want* to learn it (or are *unsure*) 
- üëç You've used it and *want* to use it again 
- üëé You've used it but *don't* *want* to use it again

properties.description: On a scale of one (very unhappy) to five (very happy), how happy you with the current overall state of testing tools?
For these tools & technologies, just check the ones that you use regularly.
Which JavaScript utilities do you regularly use?
Which text editor(s) do you regularly use?
Which browser(s) do you work in primarily during initial development?
Which build tools do you use to compile and bundle your code?
Which other languages do you code in besides JavaScript and its flavors?
What JavaScript resources do you consult?
Which CSS-related blogs/magazines/etc. do you read?
Which CSS-related sites/courses/etc. do you consult?
Which CSS or programming-related podcasts do you listen to?
How do you feel about the state of CSS?

fields.title: JavaScript is moving in the right direction
Building JavaScript apps is overly complex right now
I would like JavaScript to be my main programming language
The JavaScript ecosystem is changing too fast
What do you feel is currently missing from JavaScript?

properties.description: Features you'd like to see in JavaScript one day.
Let's get to know the real you.
How long you've been writing JavaScript.
How do you introduce yourself at parties?

choices.label: Level 1: virtually no knowledge of CSS
Level 2: using CSS frameworks and tweaking existing styles
Level 3: knowing specificity rules, being able to create layouts
Level 4: mastering animations, interactions, transitions, etc.
Level 5: being able to style an entire front-end from scratch following a consistent methodology

properties.description: How proficient are you at writing CSS? (pick the most advanced option corresponding to your skills)

choices.label: Level 1: not able to handle any back-end work
Level 2: able to set up all-in-one CMSs (WordPress, etc.) or static site generators (Jekyll, etc.)
Level 3: able to develop apps using pre-existing frameworks (Rails, Laravel, etc.)
Level 4: setting up an entire back-end from scratch (Go, Node, etc.)
Level 5: able to handle complex multi-server or microservices architectures

properties.description: How proficient are you at back-end development? (pick the most advanced option corresponding to your skills)
In USD

fields.title: How did you find out about this survey?

properties.description: If you'd like to be notified when survey results are available. Your email won't be used for any other purpose.
